intro: Erythrospermum bancanum, commonly known as the red-flowered hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, red or pink flowers that bloom during the warmer months. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various growing conditions.
